Summary: Went to Laguna to have a few days with r & r, and found this hotel with a lot of nice reviews online. When I arrived, the questions arrised at once. There was no "Welcome to our hotel", at this "hotel"!   Location is excellent. And terrible, because of it's closeness to Route-1 with traffic 24-7. Laguna city/beach 5 minutes walk from the "hotel".   This is not a hotel - this is a Bed & Breakfast, without the breakfast. With no service what so every. No room cleaning, no water, no "how are you" - nothing at all.  I am sorry, I will never return to this place. This felt like renting a room at a dodgy airbnb house, and quite pricy.   I regret booking this place and will never return. Laguna is lovely! This place is not.
Room tip: Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper - lot's of traffic noise.
Manager Response: I feel as though a quick glace at our website could confirm your observation that we are indeed not a hotel, Jan. I apologize if this was what you were hoping for, however I have absolute confidence that our rooms can more than accommodate the needs of anyone looking for a truly beautiful and luxurious getaway. The mission of our staff is to always be there for whatever needs our guests may have, so please don't hesitate to reach out next time if there's anything you feel should be addressed. I know that we can easily show you and every other traveler the full five-star getaway down the road.  All the best, Connie M., Manager

Summary: The good news is that the location is absolutely wonderful!! Located on Pacific Coast Highway, the cottages are a very short walk to the museum, a variety of restaurants and downtown Laguna. The bad news is the location...literally on the corner of Pacific Coast Highway so the traffic noise is truly horrible. I would never stay here again, solely due to the noise, which is a shame. Furthermore, while the cottage technically sleeps a max of 6 people, there is very little room to sit if you have more than 2 people.There were other smaller irritations like no instructions on how to use the heating/air system or the cable tv. The lighting isn't great for book readers.

This place is perfect!   My husband and I went for a 3 day romantic getaway.   Our windows opened up to a beautiful courtyard with gorgeous trees and at night the twinkle lights made it like a wonderland.  It honestly warmed my soul.  It’s a block from the beach and everything was gorgeous.   Will definitely come again!!! And I’ve told our kids they need to bring their significant others too.

Visiting Laguna Beach for the Pageant of the Masters.  Two nights at the Arabella were a delight!  Beautiful, well appointed rooms set in a private courtyard were just a short walk to the PoM.  Newly added AC added to the overall comfort of the stay.  Our 2nd visit in 3 years........will be back again.  Hats off to hosts Connie & Heather.

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay!
Summary: If you are staying in Laguna Beach Arabella is a must! Unlike sterile hotel rooms the cottages are appointed in such a manner that you immediately feel the warmth and comfort. The grounds are beautiful and you are within walking distance to the best beaches and restaurants in Laguna. I can’t imagine staying anywhere else to get the true Laguna experience.p

Summary Heading: Best spot in Laguna for your next visit
Summary: Staying in Laguna is a must for out of towners like myself. And if your going to do it, you might as well stay in style at Arabella Laguna.  These places are super cute and quiet.  We stayed in the violet room.

Summary Heading: A fantastic place to stay in Laguna
Summary: This cottage type location near the beach is a must stay for you and your family.  Unlike a hotel this place has exotic plants and is lush with foliage.  And of course it is a short walk to the beach and restaurants.  I've stayed there many times and I don't see why I would go anywhere else in Laguna to book my stay.  Thanks Arabella!
Room tip: All the rooms are different and unique.  You will be happy with all of them.

Summary Heading: Why we will never book a stay at Arabella Laguna again, ever...
Summary: ... Its is very hard to explain, where do you begin?  Perhaps with the familiar saying "If it is too good to be true, it probably is". You have been warned, ignored it and then will regret it.  Reading in to similar reviews, I can absolutely assure you that you rarely find some accommodation that has as much lack of anything. Charming? Not if there is a constant oder of sewage. A friendly "Hello" from the owner (must have been), forget it! She can barely talk to you and looks at you like you are the ex spouse that left for the sunset with a new partner. It is an utterly waste of money. You might as well just drive by and donate something to an unpleasant owner that is only interested in you leaving asap.  I feel for the hispanic workers that take care of the yard and the
Manager Response: Dear Andy S.,  Unfortunately, I have no record of your stay with us in the Jacaranda Cottage, or any of our other units.  Please reference the dates of your stay and the name on your reservation.  We have not received any guest complaints in recent months, so if you did stay with us, you did not contact the management staff to address any of your concerns.  Arabella Laguna

Summary: After a long flight we found the Jacaranda Cottage to be a huge disappointment. No air conditioning, ceiling fan broken, front door would not open (fire hazard), three windows would not shut, two cracked windows, super noisy, stuffy, smelled moldy, only a few "free" parking spots, no couch, and unprofessional and rude management, not on premises. None of our concerns were taken care of. We are trying to get our $$ back.

Summary Heading: Do not Stay at Arabella Laguna In the Months of June or July!!
Summary: The location is good but the room was almost at 90 degrees so hot felt like the heater was on!!  Very old buildings so even if its cool outside the rooms are extremely HOT!  I wish I could get my money back it was the worst experience.. Ants coming in from cracks in then bathroom in which they made themselves in my luggage.  The owner is very rude answers the phone with a mean Hello and quick short answer.   No AC
Manager Response: As is stated on our website, we do not have a/c and we recommend that guests leave the windows open and the fans on.  The temperatures have been very moderate and I am not sure how the room could have been 90°F during the day when it was only 80°F outside if the windows were left open with the fans on.  In addition, we have seen no evidence of ants so are unsure how they could have been present only during your stay.  We are sorry that you did not enjoy your stay but the room was as stated on our website, with all the listed amenities, and even prepared early for your early arrival for no additional charge.

Summary Heading: A nice lodging option in Laguna Beach
Summary: If you are looking for an alternative option to the pricey and small hotels in Laguna Beach, Arabella Laguna may be an option for you.  I first chose Arabella because they were dog friendly.  I was able to bring my 90 pound German Shepherd and he loved it.  The grounds are a quaint tree covered courtyard with multiple rooms and a guest cottage which is the one I rented.  The cottage is the only single residence unit so if you want complete privacy or you are bringing the family this is the unit for you.  While the cottage is not the Ritz Carlton it is very comfortable.  There is no air conditioning so be prepared to leave the windows open and fans on in the summer.  Small but functional kitchen area with a lovely breakfast nook on the porch.  We had breakfast here each morning.

The grounds are cute, but the rooms are small and HOT!  Even though it was 75 outside, the room was 82 degrees inside, even with 2 extra fans!  The traffic noise is pretty loud since you have to keep the windows open and the rooms only have shades, so the traffic lights make the room bright at night and as soon as the sun comes up, the room is really bright.  The room is tiny to maneuver around and there aren't any tables or racks to put your luggage on.  Would not stay there again...

Nice location, close to Heisler Park, beach, downtown laguna. Not very good for families with young children. No where to really eat or for the kids to play. Cottage needs some updating. Door was broken one of TV's did not work. If your over 6' tall be careful. I hit my head multiple times on low ceilings/ wall sconces/ ceiling fans. Owner was responsive to get the door fixed

We recently stayed for 2 weeks in the Myrtle Cottage. Very comfortable upstairs suite with a room with a king bed and one with a queen bed, and 2 bathrooms. Easy walk to downtown Laguna, and to the beach. Very nice and private courtyard, and a laundry room. Beach chairs and umbrellas available, and convenient parking. Would definitely stay here again. Only criticism is that we never saw the management staff, and there is a $50 charge if you want a change of linens.

Fantastic place! We stayed in one of the studios. It was like being at home far away. It was also very good service and a lovely garden to sit in. Close to the beach as well. We cooked in the small but clean kitchen and there is also washing machine and drier for use.

This place is a great find! Nestled right on PCH hidden behind trees and bushes a special place exists a small hotel with rooms, and a house and cottage to rent. The place is so quaint and you feel like you are in the mountains a block form the beach.  Great location to head to the parks and beaches just a few blocks from the shops and restaurants. Rooms are nice and feel roomy and come with a small kitchen.  They allow dogs for a small fee. They have a great outdoor area with tables chairs and a barbecue. Great find highly recommend!

Arabella Laguna is a great place to stay if you want to live like a local!  Convenient to the beach, grocery store, museums and restaurants.  There are 2 cottages to rent  but most of the rooms are 1 bedroom or studio apts with beautiful furnishings and fully equipped kitchens.  There are a few beach items available to use in the laundry room, but be sure to bring your own beach chairs, towels and umbrellas.   We had no problems with parking or noise from other guests, what a treat.  Everyone was respectful and professional.  High points: Location, decor, convenience of kitchen  Low points: street traffic noise , uninvited ants

The location is just across the street from the beach and within walking distance from good food and shopping. This is laguna beach so the shopping is pricey. All and all a very good location.  cottages are in fact a small apartment complex with a courtyard. The courtyard has 3 unattached larger cottages. Cottages are nice and quaint.  The staff is not there on weekends with the exception of a small cleaning crew. I feel the front desk staff is slow to correspond via email and is hard to get a hold of by phone. This was inconvenient for me as I actually live more than an hour away and could not just stop by and take care of business. All and all it was a good trip and I would do it again and recommend it to any romantics with a budget.

This is our second visit here and once again, we were more than pleased. It's so beautiful and relaxing, yet a short walk to town and a shorter walk to the beach. The Jacaranda Cottage is a rare find. Next time we're gonna try the Myrtle Cottage. Thanks for a great weekend!

Extraordinary and Charming.  We live in Laguna and  got married at Arabella.  We rented the venue for the reception (we walked a block to Heisler Park for the ceremony), hosted a wedding brunch and housed the family there as well.  It is an extraordinary property and the rooms were perfect.  Comfortable, great beds and plenty of space for everyone to spread out with common spaces to relax and visit.  The property is a "surprise" even to our neighbors in Laguna who pass it daily.  It is charming and magical with something beautiful to see wherever you look.  The catering cottage was perfect for the rehearsal dinner as well as the wedding food preparation and a buffet table allows for easy serving and access.  The catering companies we used both loved it and it is fully equipped

Yes, the location of Arabella Laguna is within walking distance to the beach and downtown Laguna. My room was fine, but not a cottage. There are a lot of stairs to and bad night lighting on the property.  They could use some TLC around the property and some new outdoor furniture.  However, this isn't about the accommodations but a warning about the expectations of the management that are worth mentioning here since you may not learn about any of this until you check in.  Guests are expected to do their own housekeeping, including swapping out towels, taking out the garbage, doing the dishes, making the bed or risk paying additional daily fees.  What?  Shouldn't this be provided in a place that charges $200+ per night? The owner was crabby and my stay was marred by several issues

Just returned from a wonderful weekend at Arabella Laguna. My family surprised me with a "reunion" birthday party and our family took over 4 of the units plus the living area with the catering kitchen. The property is gorgeous---spacious, charming, has very comfy beds and is well located for walking to restaurants and shops. There was room for adults to gather and party while the kids ran around on the spacious lawn area or watched one of the multiple TVs in our rooms. The kitchens are well stocked and there are laundry facilities for longer stays. We will definitely return!

My house was being painted and uninhabitable, so I got to be a visitor in my own town. A friend recommended Arabella Laguna. Very nice. Since I was only there a few nights, I chose the Heather suite. It overlooks the garden courtyard but had a partial view of the ocean. It's a studio, meaning it's like a hotel room (king bed) with a full kitchen and a fairly large bathroom with shower. The room was very nicely decorated and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The bed and bath linens deserve a special mention as they were extra nice. I'm noise sensitive, and PCH is close. But, I slept soundly. The kitchen is well equipped if you want to cook, or at least make coffee. Apparently, the larger units come with a dishwasher. There is no A/C. I live nearby and nobody has it. You

Summary Heading: Noisy  stay, could get better location for same  $$
Summary: Beware of  noise from Hwy 1 and hidden charges. Arabella will charge $50 per extra guest per night  without  providing additional bedding. These charges were not disclosed during online booking.    I would not stay there for more than 2 nights because of the noise  from Hwy 1 . If you have your windows open ( which is the only option to get fresh air) then be ready to wake up to every motorcycle passing by .  Closest beach is not the best in the area, so we had to drive to better location anyway… Next time when I visit Laguna Beach I will explore other accommodation options.

We stayed at Arabella Laguna for several nights in the Foxglove suite. It was nice comfortable clean and unusual. The property is beautifully landscaped and quiet. You feel like you are staying at someone's home rather than a rental property. The location is in north Laguna and very easy to go anywhere in town with the free open air trolley. There are just a few rentals so it's not crowded or noisey. Parking is good as long as each guess has one vehicle. Otherwise parking is on the street with Meter. Very close to beach and restaurants. No AC so if the weather is expected to be hot reschedule!!  Overall this is a lovely property. Will visit again. Also pictures on website do not represent the property correctly. It is much nicer in person.

We stayed in the smaller Lavender Suite for 4 nights - it was furnished really nicely, clean with good, working facilities and a fresh supply of linen and utensils if we needed them. The place itself is only a few minutes from the main beach and restaurants and shops so an ideal location - it is also hidden from view and has a gorgeous little garden with swing seats and a BBQ. The only minor negative was that it was sometimes hard to get in touch with the owners to confirm bookings etc. However, the whole admin process ran smoothly in the end and we enjoyed our time there! AND, really great value for what you get! Would recommend!

We stayed in one of the suites here last week on a combination conference/ vacation trip to the West Coast and LOVED it!  An easy 25-30 min commute into Annaheim on the days with  meetings, and much better scenery to come home to.  The bed was firmly sumptuous, the grounds were lovely, complete with little groups of outdoor seating and a bbq.  Our kitchen was very well-appointed, including little things like wine glasses, a couple of big serving bowls, salt and pepper.  Everything was upscale, charming, and very inviting.  The place really is true to the pictures on their website. The shower was on the small side, not a problem for us but might be for very large individuals; it had plenty of hot water and lots of water pressure.  Complete with shampoo, conditioner, and nice body

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay in the Violet Suite.  The pictures on the web-site are true to form; however, PARKING is an issue.  Also, Tuesday and Wednesday are street sweeping days so you have to be careful not to get your vehicle towed by parking on the wrong day. The stairs up to the rooms on the second floor are a little steep and there are no handicap bars in the showers; so, be careful!  All and all,  I will definitely be returning to this lovely hide-a-way!

Had the most wonderful stay at the Arabella Laguna! Hubby and I together with my sister and her husband stayed here during the Pageant of the Masters show. We reserved the Historic Myrtle Cottage. Lovely, lovely rooms! Will definitely be staying here again.

My family and I just stayed at Arabella Laguna and it was wonderful. We stayed in the Jacaranda Cottage and Delphinium Suite.  The rooms were quaint, the grounds were beautiful, and the location was great. The children were able to safely run from room to room and play on the lawn and the adults were able to relax on the comfortable lawn furniture, enjoy the lush grounds and talk. When it was time to go to the beach, all we had to do was walk across the street and we were there.  The same can be said for the grocery store and eateries. Arabella Laguna is charming and it made my family get away memorable and relaxing.

Summary Heading: Great Location and Property - Could be Managed More Effectively
Summary: As a prolonged layover on a trip to Hawaii we stayed two nights at the Arabella in Laguna Beach to visit with family from California.  We were pleased to be upgraded to their cottage property for no extra charge.  The property was clean, cozy and pleasant.  The location was phenomenal.  Cross the street and walk for 2 minutes to be at a marvelous beach!  I wish that the property were managed more effectively though because it has such great potential.  Interacting with the management was "mysterious".  We made our reservations over the internet, but never got a confirmation e-mail  (very unnerving when you make a credit card purchase!)- and had to call multiple times leaving requests on machines to finally confirm our reservation.      Signs on the property are virtually

Summary Heading: Really cute cottage and a great location!
Summary: My husband & I stayed at Arabella Laguna for a couple nights.  We had the detached Jacaranda cottage.  The whole property is so quaint with a beautifully maintained garden.  The cottage was very nicely decorated and had a fully stocked kitchen!  We definitely felt like we were in the home away from home.  A very different experience from staying in a hotel.   There were only a few minor items which may not be bothersome to some people.  The blinds in the bedroom can totally be seen through at night.  It also was difficult in the morning to sleep in.  We ended up hanging towels to try and get privacy.  Also if you were staying with a family or friends because the cottage can accommodate up to people, the living room has a few windows with the same problem.  The location can't be

Absolutely charming! The one bedroom, kitchen, living room and bath was beyond belief. Every thing was  spotless..big fluffy towels, decorations were wonderful...could have stayed a week. Other friends had a huge two bedroom upstairs apartment with flat screen tv's and everything one would need in the kitchen. Connie the manager was so helpful..waters in refrigerator and told as everything we needed to know about Laguna. I am very skeptical about internet reservations..but finding this made everyone think I had the magic touch. This is our to go to place in Laguna.  Thank you! Thank you!

we stayed at arabella laguna for one week in march 2011. we booked the jacaranda cottage, which had enough room for our family of four and a very nice kitchen. the garden is really beautiful and our kids loved to explore and play in the garden. Although PCH is right in front of the property, we didn't feel disturbed and when windows are closed you nearly don't hear any noise. city center and main beach are a ten minute walk and about the same distance is beautiful crescent bay and crescent bay point park. we would definitely return to this great place!

Summary Heading: Very comfortable, well run, friendly and excellent location
Summary: Laguna Beach is one of the few Californian beach towns that has retained the village feel. Arabella was reccommended by friends, and we had a very pleasant stay. Location is only two minutes from the superb Heisler Park clifftop walkway leading into Main beach and the town centre. The rooms were very comfortable and had all the facilities we wanted, including off-street parking. We have no hesitation in reccommending this charming property to anyone looking for first class self catering in Laguna Beach
